name: Favrielle Doll pdf
description:
Autumn is Favrielle’s favorite season. She’s easy to pose, and can sit and cross her legs. A wonderful whimsical addition to doll collectors of all ages, Favrielle is fun to make with worsted-weight acrylic yarn with a touch of Fun Fur.

Skill level: Intermediate

Size

22” tall.

Materials

Worsted weight yarn. Doll shown was made with Red Heart Super Saver and Lion Brand Fun Fur.

G hook for worsted-weight yarn or hook size appropriate to achieve a firm but not stiff crochet fabric. H and K hooks.

For eyes: black half-ball shank buttons or other doll eyes as desired; eyes may be embroidered if doll is intended to be used as a toy.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished doll

name: How to Make a Crochet Nappy Cake pdf
description:
Create a beautiful baby gift that doubles as the centerpiece for a baby shower. Soft and cuddly crocheted toys, bib, booties, edgings, bottle covers and more are combined with purchased cloth and disposable diapers (called “nappies” in Europe) to create a gorgeous tiered cake that will be the highlight of a shower.

This colorful cake  is made by first arranging about 85 disposable diapers. Then the cake is “frosted” with crochet-trimmed baby blankets, crochet baby toys, bibs, bottle covers, booties, tiny crocheted roses and as many purchased and crocheted baby products as you wish to add.

Size

Cake shown is about 18” tall. Bottom layer is 14” across.

Materials

Baby yarn used throughout this project is Bernat Baby Coordinates. Other brands of baby yarn and any color scheme may be used. Colors used for this project are #1000 White, #1001 Pink, #1008 Baby Pink, #1010 Soft Mauve (lavender), #1011 Lemon Custard, and #1012 Iced Mint.

Crochet hooks size F through I

About 85 disposable diapers are used, as well as ribbons, pins and purchased baby items.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished cake

name: Amigurumi Nativity pdf
description:
Called “amigurumi” in Japan—translation “knitted doll”—little crocheted animals and dolls have become a favorite of collectors worldwide.

Celebrate the holidays with a sweet little manger scene in the amigurumi style. Made with worsted-weight yarn, this set includes Mary, Joseph, baby Jesus, angel, three wise men, and animals.

Skill level

Intermediate

Size

Standing figures are about 6” tall; animals are 3 1/2”=4” tall, and baby in manger is 2 1/2” x 4”.

Materials

Worsted weight yarn in colors specified in each pattern, or colors of choice

F or G crochet hook

3/8” half-ball shank buttons or other eyes as desired

Tapestry needle

Sewing needle and thread for attaching eyes

Polyester fiberfill

Safety Notice

Buttons and small parts can be a hazard to small children. To be safe, all animals intended for use as toys should have embroidered eyes.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished dolls

name: Magical Santa Elf Doll pdf
description:
Make your list and check it twice with the help of this whimsical little fellow. He’s made with worsted-weight yarn and baby eyelash yarn. He’s wearing a very fetching pink and green outfit, but could easily be made in other colors to suit your holiday decorating tastes. Bright red and green, cranberry and pine, shades of white and cream, silver and gold— all these color schemes, along with gold or silver jingle bells as you wish,  are beautiful for this adorable little guy. His jointed legs allow him to sit or stand.  Skill level: intermediate.

Size

17” tall standing.

Materials

Body parts  are made with size G hook and worsted-weight yarn, and are stuffed with polyester fiberfill.

Safety Notice

Buttons and small parts can be a hazard to small children. To be safe, all stuffed characters intended for use as toys should have embroidered eyes (instructions included).

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished doll

name: Elsbeth Doll pdf
description:
This pretty ballerina’s shapely legs and torso take shape stitch by stitch with single crochet increases and decreases. Elsbeth is pure magic dressed in her tulle skirt trimmed with thread crochet roses and leaves, and accented with narrow satin ribbon.

Skill level: Intermediate

Size

17” tall

Materials

Four-ply worsted-weight yarn in colors of choice including:

A               pale pink or pale peach for skin color

B               mint green or pale turquoise for legs

C               lavender for leotard

D              rust for hair

E               Scraps of pink for mouth

F               Scraps of pale blue for eyes

Size 10 crochet cotton thread in light pink and soft green or colors of choice for roses and leaves

Crochet hook size F or G or size needed to obtain gauge

Size 6 steel crochet hook

10 yds 1/8” lavender satin ribbon

7 yds 1/8” blue satin ribbon

60” x 11” rectangle of  pale lavender or blue tulle fabric (can be iridescent)

Sewing needle and thread to match tulle and roses

Polyester stuffing

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished doll

name: Topsy Turvy Doll pdf
description:
This absolutely adorable crocheted doll has a skirt that flips over to reveal a second doll on the underneath side. Depending on how the skirt is flipped, the doll looks completely different. On one side she is all dressed up in her bonnet and pink dress, and on the other side she is a beautiful ballerina with a pretty bun and ruffled skirt.

Size

Doll is about 12” tall

Materials

She’s crocheted with DK-weight or worsted-weight yarn

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished doll

name: How to Make Tunisian Crochet Entrelac pdf
description:
This pattern contains step-by-step photos and instructions for several configurations of entrelac including diamonds on point, diagonal stripes, around the world, and sunshine and shadow. Instructions are included for a project in each configuration, and instructions are given for using these techniques to make any square or rectangular project of any size from potholders to full-size afghans.

Skill level: Intermediate.

Materials and gauge: Tunisian crochet entrelac may be worked with any yarn and appropriate hook size. Generally, best results are obtained with any type of Tunisian crochet when it's worked with a larger hook than you would use for traditional crochet with a particular yarn. The projects in this pattern were made with worsted-weight cotton yarn and size K Tunisian hook.

Tunisian crochet is normally worked with a long, straight Tunisian hook; however, since Tunisian entrelac is worked with only a few crochet stitches on the hook at a time, regular crochet hooks may be used. The technique is Tunisian-but the hook need not necessarily be a Tunisian hook.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished designs

name: Hazel Shawl pdf
description:
This lovely design is the perfect project for anyone looking for an easy-to-crochet batwing shawl for any season or occasion. Curved top edge shaping fits beautifully around shoulders and is worked from the neck down, growing longer and wider with each row. The simple lace repeat on the upper portion is made with only single crochet and chain stitches, and can be made in your desired length before adding the border pattern.

Skill level

Intermediate

Size

Fits all sizes; can be made to size desired with any yarn and appropriate hook size.

Materials

Shawl may be made with any yarn and appropriate hook size. Full size shawl shown was made with about 650 yds. (about 6   1/2  102-yd. balls) Patons Silk Bamboo #85107 Sapphire (weight category 3-light worsted weight) and size G hook; small shawl/scarf shown was made with about 450 yds. (about two 231-yd. skeins) KnitPicks Essential Tweed/Stroll Tweed Plum Tweed (weight category 1-fingering weight sock yarn) and size F hook.

With most category 3 and 4 yarns (light worsted or DK weight and worsted-weight), a size G hook would be too small and would produce a stiff fabric. However, for this project I chose a size G for the silk-bamboo blend for my preference of drape and stitch definition.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished shawl

name: Gingerbread Cottage pdf
description:
Create a darling gingerbread house entirely with crochet! Fun to make and fun to display, this confection is made with simple stitches and techniques. Candy tree completes the setting.

Size

10” high x 12” x 12”

Materials

Red Heart Supersaver Solids worsted-weight yarn:

About 350 yds. Café, and small amounts Cherry Red, Spring Green, Paddy Green and Soft White.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished cottage

name: Madison: A Perfectly Charming Jointed Bear to Crochet pdf
description:
Whether you make this little sweetheart in thread, worsted-weight yarn, bulky yarn, or anything in between, Madison is a fun and easy jointed bear that makes a beloved gift for bear lovers of all ages. Depending on the age of the recipient, joints and eyes can be created with buttons, beads, or simply yarn.

Size

Madison is about 11” tall standing when made with worsted yarn.

Materials

Worsted weight or other yarn in color of choice. Bear shown is made with about 5 oz. Patons Canadiana #24471 Beige.

G hook for worsted-weight yarn or hook size appropriate to achieve a firm but not stiff crochet fabric

For eyes: black half-ball shank buttons for eyes (bear shown was made with 3/8” diameter buttons) OR black yarn for embroidering eyes

For button or bead joints: Four four-hole flat buttons OR four beads large enough not to slip between crochet stitches

Safety notice

Buttons and small parts can be a hazard to small children. Instructions are included for creating embroidered eyes and yarn-only joints for bears for children under the age of three.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished bear

name: How to Make Easy Tunisian Crochet Entrelac pdf
description:
The beautiful diagonal basketweave look of entrelac has long been a favorite of knitters. I’ve simplified the classic technique for Tunisian crochet, and added dozens of photos to this booklet to take you step-by-step through the process. Making Tunisian entrelac is quite addicting! Once you start you won’t want to stop.

With my methods, you can make afghans or other projects of any width without a long starting chain. Entrelac is also great for scrap projects with any yarn.

This booklet includes instructions and step-by-step photos for three variations of Tunisian entrelac. All versions are worked from the front; work is not turned.

Plum Perfect Afghan is made with whole entrelac blocks resulting in zig-zag edges. Fancy Pillow is made in the same manner as the afghan, except it is finished with fill-in triangles on all the edges to create straight edges. Beautiful Baby Afghan is made with end triangles worked as a part of every other row, creating straight sides. Fill-in triangles on ends of afghan are added last.

Although the projects in this book were designed to be made with large Tunisian hooks (Size L-P), the technique will work as beautifully with any size Tunisian hook. Indeed, since there are only a few loops of your work on the shaft of your hook at any given time, Tunisian entrelac can be worked with regular crochet hooks. This booklet is a fabulous primer guide to Tunisian entrelac, no matter what yarn or hook you prefer to use.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished articles

name: Kimberli Jacket pdf
description:
This lovely jacket has many options! Designed with a beautiful, yet understated and uncomplicated stitch pattern, Kimberli can be crocheted with any yarn and appropriate hook size, with straight or swing shaping. Choose from several trim styles—two options of lace trim around all edges, or either of the lace trim options around only the bottom and sleeves with a very narrow plain edge along fronts and neck edge.

Classic, versatile design

Any combination of options adds up to fun stitching and easy-fitting results. This classic garment is one you may want to make several times—depending on your choice of yarn and options chosen, Kimberli is equally beautiful for dressy, professional and casual outfits. It's a really versatile pattern that works up into a beautiful garment that anyone, even those who don't prefer busier crocheted lace patterns, will love to wear.

Top-down construction

Kimberli is worked from the top down. You choose your trim option in advance, then crochet from the outset to accommodate your chosen edging for perfect fit and coverage. Top down construction means no seams to sew—when you're finished crocheting, just weave in the ends, add one or more buttons if you wish, and you're done!

Specific instructions and schematics are given to make garments for sizes S-4X; however, this design really shines when used as a fit-as-you-go design and can be custom fitted to ANY size literally from baby to super-plus adult. This is especially well-suited for making pretty little sweaters for any size tween girls—just use bust size in the chart below to help you estimate yarn amounts needed, and custom fit as you crochet, either trying the garment on or using a few measurements from a good-fitting existing garment.

Skill level

Intermediate

Materials needed

Kimberli can be made with any yarn and appropriate hook size. Jackets shown are size S and are made with the following:

Green jacket-straight shaping, lace edging #1; made with Caron Spa weight category 3 (light worsted/DK weight) bamboo/acrylic blend, #0004 Green Sheen, 1025 yds and size I hook

Cobalt blue jacket-swing shaping, lace edging #2; made with Omega Sinfonia weight category 2 (sport weight) mercerized cotton, Azul Bey, 1100 yds and size H hook

Orchid jacket-straight shaping, lace edging #1; made with Lion Brand Cupcake weight category 4 (thick worsted weight) crinkly acrylic/nylon blend, 675 yds and size J hook

Eggplant fuzzy jacket-- straight shaping, lace edging #1 at bottom and sleeves only; made with Lion Brand Moonlight Mohair weight category 5 (bulky) mohair blend, 675 yds and size L hook

Yarn amounts are in yards and are approximate—-yarn amounts may vary somewhat depending on custom fitting, length and options. Garment is custom-fitted and can be made to fit any size, but these sizes are given for making garments for gift-giving and as a guideline for estimating yarn amounts.

name: Elfin Baby Sets pdf
description:
Your little baby elf will be so sweet in these darling cap and bootie sets. Booties feature pointy and curly elfin toes with ties to keep them securely on baby’s feet. Caps fit closely to baby’s head with the addition of three styles of crown—curly point, rounded point and more pronounced point. Leaves, daisies and roses trim hat brims and bootie cuffs.

Size

preemie, newborn, three months and six months.

Skill level

Intermediate

Materials

Daisy Faerie Set

150 yds. baby yarn; pink or main color desired

Small amounts baby yarn; white, yellow and green

Item shown was made with Baby Bee Sweet Delight Baby, #40 Boo Pink (pink), #10 Angel (white), #16 Sun Kisses (yellow), #30 Froggy (green).

Rose Pixie Set

150 yds. baby yarn; light blue or main color desired

Small amounts baby yarn; pink, rose, peach, lavender, medium blue, green

Item shown was made with Baby Bee Sweet Delight Baby, #50 Baby’s Blue (light blue), #40 Boo Pink (pink), #33 Little Princess (rose), #76 Bashful (peach), #56 Iris Dreams (lavender), #39 Meema’s Blue (medium blue), #30 Froggy (green).

Woodsy Elf Set

150 yds. baby yarn; tan or main color desired

Small amounts baby yarn; light blue, medium blue, green

Item shown was made with Baby Bee Sweet Delight Baby, #14 Teddy (tan), #50 Baby’s Blue (light blue), #39 Meema’s Blue (medium blue), #30 Froggy (green).

name: Merrylee Cardigan Shawl pdf
description:
This elegant, motif edged-shawl is similar to a shawl or wrap with its drape and easy fit, yet features arm openings for a cardigan-like shape. Made with DK weight or light-worsted-weight yarn. Instructions are sized to fit S-5X.

Skill level: intermediate

Size

XS-5X with sizing instructions for petite to tall.

Materials

Weight category 3 yarn (DK or light worsted-weight). Garment shown is made with Lion Brand Microspun and size I crochet hook.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished garment

name: Amigurumi Little Friends pdf
description:
Crochet this group of little friends with scraps of worsted-weight yarn. Called “amigurumi” in Japan—translation “knitted doll”—little crocheted animals and dolls have become a favorite of collectors worldwide. This collection includes Bridgette Bear, Cattarina Ballerina, Malcolm Mouse, Felicia Firefly, Karla Koala, Florian Frog and Bailey Beagle, all approximately 3 to 4 1/2” tall. Skill level: Easy.

Size

3” to 4 1/2” tall

Materials

Worsted weight yarn in colors specified in each pattern, or colors of choice

F or G crochet hook

1/8” half-ball shank buttons or other eyes as desired (I used #753 Black 1/8”/5mm La Petite buttons by Blumenthal Lansing, 5 to a card, purchased at JoAnn Fabrics)

Tapestry needle

Sewing needle and thread for attaching eyes

Polyester fiberfill

Safety Notice

Buttons and small parts can be a hazard to small children. To be safe, all animals intended for use as toys should have embroidered eyes.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished dolls

name: Alicia Collection Pillows pdf
description:
Enjoy the fun and relaxation of crochet with a trio of spunky decorative pillows with a retro flair. Classic designs interpreted in today’s colors create simple elegance and fun crochet. Three pillows, all made with worsted-weight yarn.

Size

Round pillows are 16” across; rectangular pillow is 12”x16”.

Materials

All are made with 4-ply worsted-weight yarn. Pillows shown are made with Red Heart Classic and 16” and 12”x16” pillow forms.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished pillows

name: Sweet Treats Potholders pdf
description:
Frosted cupcakes, sugar cookie, slice of cake and dish of ice cream—all made into cute-as-a-button crocheted potholders. Create these confections for the cook in 100% cotton yarn for washability. Five potholders.

Size

Each potholder is about 6” across.

Materials

Projects shown are made with worsted-weight cotton yarn.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished items

name: Sugar and Spice Amigurumi pdf
description:
Sugar and spice and everything nice—that’s what these amigurumi are made of! Little girls or anyone who loves pink will adore these sweet little characters including cat, butterfly, pony, bunny, princess, and puppy.

Size

4-6” tall

Skill level

Intermediate

Materials

All animals are made with size G hook and worsted-weight yarn, and are stuffed with polyester fiberfill.

Safety Notice

Buttons and small parts can be a hazard to small children. To be safe, all animals intended for use as toys should have embroidered eyes.

name: Uptown Downtown Shrug pdf
description:
Wear this sleeveless summertime shrug two ways! Shaped armholes give a neat fit, while the collar/bottom edge is much fuller on one side than the other. One way, garment forms a long, slimmer, more casual silhouette with a sweet smaller collar and fuller and longer lower back and front edge.

Flip the garment over and swap armholes, and the collar forms a lovely capelet to keep your shoulders warm over a bare dress or top. Worn this way, the length is shorter for a flattering dressy effect.

Either way, this garment can be overlapped in front or pinned in a variety of ways.

Size

S-5X

Materials

Soft worsted-weight yarn. Garment shown was made with Caron Simply Soft #9705 Sage

Size I and J hooks or sizes needed to obtain gauge

name: Happy Holidays Amigurumi pdf
description:
Ring in the holidays with this merry collection of crochet friends perfect for little gifts, decorations and more. Includes Ballerina, Elf, Snowman, Mr. and Mrs. Santa, and Christmas Ball, all made with size G hook and worsted-weight yarn. 3 ½” to 6” tall plus hats.

Size

3 ½” to 6” tall plus hats.

Materials

Worsted-weight yarn and size G hook; stuffing; half-ball shank buttons.

Safety Notice

Buttons and small parts can be a hazard to small children. To be safe, all animals intended for use as toys should have embroidered eyes.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished dolls

name: Gwendolyn Doll pdf
description:
Gwendolyn is pure whimsy with her striped legs, entrelac skirt, fuzzy hair and pointy boots. She’s great fun to make with worsted-weight yarns highlighted with a dash of eyelash yarn for hair.

Most crocheters with a bit of experience making dolls and toys can make this doll in one day or a couple of evenings.

Gwendolyn is the first in my new series of artistic, creative dolls. I've always felt such a sense of empowerment and happiness creating unusual dolls and I hope you will feel the same. Make her for a special friend, a daughter, a mother, or just for yourself!

Note: Entrelac is an essentially Tunisian crochet technique that can be done with a regular crochet hook because there are only a few loops at a time on the hook. The skirt is entrelac but the rest of the doll is ordinary crochet.

Size

17” tall

Skill level

Intermediate

Materials

I used good old Red Heart Super Saver and Classic to make Gwendolyn, with a little Fun Fur for her hair. I hope you will change the colors partially, or entirely, as your whim (and your stash) suits you :) 

Red and yellow doll colors:
Red: 912 Cherry Red
Skin: 719 Lily Pink or 2118 Baby Pink 
Hot pink: 727 Hot Pink
Yellow: 230 Yellow 
Orange: 254 Pumpkin
White: 1 White
Hair: Lion Brand Fun Fetti Firecracker Red

Aqua and lavender doll colors:
Skin: 363 Pale Green
Medium turquoise: 513 Parakeet
Teal: 48 Teal
Light lavender: 579 Light Lavender
Lavender: 584 Lavender
Purple: 596 Purple
Hair: Lion Brand Fancy Fur lavender

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished doll

name: Celtic Cross pdf
description:
This heirloom design, reminiscent of Celtic tatting,  can be crocheted with size 20 thread and size 10 steel hook, for a finished cross about 5 1/4” x 8 1/2”. Or, it can me made with size 10 thread and a size 9 hook, for a finished cross about 6” x 9 1/2”.

Materials

Small cross shown was made with white size 20 thread; large cross was made with size 10 thread in white, pink and pale green.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished cross

name: Learn to Crochet by Making Amigurumi pdf
description:
Called “amigurumi” in Japan—translation “knitted doll”—little crocheted animals and dolls have become a favorite of collectors worldwide.

Designed for the beginning crocheter, this amigurumi how-to pattern features step-by-step photos to show and tell the stitches and steps needed to crochet, assemble and embellish an irresistible 7” amigurumi bear.

Skill level: Beginner

Size

7” tall

Materials

Worsted weight yarn in colors specified in each pattern, or colors of choice

F or G crochet hook

3/8” half-ball shank buttons or other eyes as desired

Tapestry needle

Sewing needle and thread for attaching eyes

Polyester fiberfill

Safety Notice

Buttons and small parts can be a hazard to small children. To be safe, all animals intended for use as toys should have embroidered eyes.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished bear

name: Amigurumi in the Garden pdf
description:
This springtime fresh amigurumi collection features three "Flower
Girls"—Daisy, Rose and Sunflower—plus Garden Gnome, Mushroom,
Dragonfly, Ladybug and Monarch Butterfly. 3 to 4 1/2" tall, these
amigurumi are made with worsted-weight yarn and basic stitches.
Perfect for small gifts and cute decorations, these are delightful
additions to any amigurumi collection. Skill level: Easy.

Size

3” to 4 1/2” tall

Materials

Worsted weight yarn in colors specified in each pattern, or colors of choice

F or G crochet hook

1/8” half-ball shank buttons or other eyes as desired (I used #753 Black 1/8”/5mm La Petite buttons by Blumenthal Lansing, 5 to a card, purchased at JoAnn Fabrics)

Tapestry needle

Sewing needle and thread for attaching eyes

Polyester fiberfill

Safety Notice

Buttons and small parts can be a hazard to small children. To be safe, all animals intended for use as toys should have embroidered eyes.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished dolls

name: Delilah Pearl Collection Thread Baby Shoes pdf
description:
Three adorable baby shoe designs are made with colorful size 10 crochet thread. Instructions are included for size preemie or doll size, newborn, and three to six months. These beautiful little shoes hold their shape and go with baby's cutest outfits for portraits, special occasions or everyday. And after baby grows, place these sweet little shoes on the Christmas tree each year to bring back cherished memories.

Size

Preemie/doll, newborn, 3-6 months

Skill level

Intermediate

Materials

Size 10 cotton crochet thread (bedspread weight) in main color and three contrasting colors. Shoes shown were made with J&P Coats Royale Classic Crochet #10:

#479 Bridal Blue

#428 Mint

#493 French Rose

#422 Golden Yellow

One ball of each color contains ample thread to make all shoes shown. Each pair of shoes requires about 35 yards sole color, about 50 yards upper color, and small amounts of contrasting colors for edging, butterflies, flowers or fish.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished shoes

name: Olivia Pineapple Skirt pdf
description:
This lovely, lacy skirt is made in two segments—the skirt top section and the pineapple border. Because it was designed in this manner, you have more control over the length of the finished skirt. You make the pineapple border first so you know exactly how much length the border adds to the finished skirt. Then, setting the border aside, you start at the waist and make the skirt body to your desired length. You then attach the skirt to the border.

This design is a slim-fitting skirt with a flared, slightly ruffled border. Pattern is written with instructions for fitting any size using any yarn or thread.

This elegant skirt is to be worn over a lightweight soft skirt. Skirt can be worn at waistline or low on hips as desired.

Size

Pattern is written with instructions for fitting any size using any yarn or thread.

Materials

To make this skirt, I recommend Royale Fashion Crochet size 3, Aunt Lydia’s Fashion Crochet size 3, Royale Luna Fashion, or Aunt Lydia’s Shimmer Fashion, all by J&P Coats. Luster Sheen by Coats and Clark is also a very good choice. Other possible threads of about the same weight are Patons Grace, Speed-Cro-Sheen, various brands of cabled cotton thread, DMC Senso size 3, and a doubled strand of size 10 crochet cotton thread.

name: Cupcake Tree  pdf
description:
Have fun crocheting this collection of fanciful frosted cupcakes! Tiered display stand is perfect for displaying all your small crocheted desserts and treats.

Size

Each cupcake is 3 1/2” to 4” high; stand is about 7” high.

Materials

Project shown is made with worsted-weight acrylic yarn.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished items

name: Chocolate Sweets and Treats pdf
description:
Milk chocolate, white chocolate, dark chocolate—what’s your passion? These irresistible crocheted chocolate cakes, cookies and desserts are life-size.  Chocolate Decadence Cake, Individual Three-tiered Cakes, Chocolate Fudge Cupcake, Chocolate Chip Cookies, Chocolate Dipped Strawberries and more.

Size

Cake is 9” across and fits a standard glass cake pedestal with domed lid.

Materials

All projects were made with 4-ply acrylic worsted-weight yarn.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished items

name: Pamelyn Summer Shrug pdf
description:
Add a touch of lacy crochet goodness to your favorite casual or dressy outfit. This shrug design features cap-style armholes, just-right lacy edging and a shamelessly pretty bow closure—or you can use a little brooch or whatever strikes your fancy.

Size

XS (S-M, L-XL, 2X, 3X)

Materials

5 (6, 6, 6, 7) oz Lion Brand Baby Soft #920-153 Black, or any sport-weight or weight category 3 yarn

I hook or size needed to obtain gauge

18 inches 5/8”-1/2” wide grosgrain or satin ribbon

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished garment

name: Holiday Sweets and Treats pdf
description:
Make your holidays merrier with this collection of crocheted sweets. Goodies include meringue and gumdrop topiary,  pink petits fours, Christmas pudding, yule log, peppermint spiral lollipop, gingerbread man, and Santa’s snowflake cookies and cocoa.

Skill level

Intermediate

Size

Topiary shown is 10 inches tall but can be made to fit any size Styrofoam cone. Cocoa can be made to fit any cup. Remaining goodies are 2-5” across.

Materials

Worsted weight yarn

Styrofoam cone

Stuffing

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished treats

name: Floribunda Scarf pdf
description:
A profusion of roses, buds and leaves dance along this beautiful, artistic scarf.

A simple scarf base is embellished with 3-D roses, leaf sprays, bell flowers and rosebuds to make a unique wearable art piece you’ll treasure. It’s the perfect gift for yourself, a sister, mother, grandmother, or special friend.

Size

Finished scarf is about 60-70” long.

Materials

I encourage you to use scraps and odd balls of yarns and ribbons you might already have on hand for the elements of this scarf. This is a project worthy of using that one fabulous ball of discontinued yarn that you have saved! Pull out all your scraps, choose 6-7 worsted weight, eyelash, and ribbons that go together. It takes one 90 yd., 50gm ball of the main yarn to make the scarf base.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished scarf

name: Baby Essentials pdf
description:
This simple, sweet and soft newborn ensemble makes a beautiful gift. Choose a soft baby yarn in a favorite color for the kimono sacque, hat, booties and afghan. Add tiny flower or bird crochet appliqués for a special, understated touch. This pattern is suitable for beginning crocheters and features simple stitches and construction for easy crocheting and beautiful results. Size: newborn, 3 months.

Skill level: Easy

Size

Pattern is written for size newborn and 3 months.

Materials

Main color baby yarn:

                 18 oz (1134 yds) for afghan

4 ½ oz (277 yds) for kimono sacque

                 1 oz (63 yds) for hat

                 1 oz (63 yds) for booties

For appliqués: small amounts pink and yellow for flower and bird. Tiny scrap of blue baby yarn or embroidery floss for bird eye.

2 yds 3/8” satin ribbon in pale yellow or color desired (if you use yarn with color specks, choose ribbon in a color to match specks)

name: Natalie Collection Felted Handbags pdf
description:
Have fun felting with these whimsical floral handbags. Choose several pretty colors of 100% wool worsted-weight yarn, then crochet bags, flowers and leaves with a size N hook. Felt using your washing machine for a beautiful finished result.

Size

Rectangular handbag is about 6” high, 10” wide and 4” deep at base.

Round-base handbag shown is about 7” high, 5” across at base.

Formulas are given for figuring out felting shrinkage to make any size bag.

name: Lisette Sweater Shawl pdf
description:
Treat yourself to this wonderful meshy shawl with a deep, lacy, scalloped pineapple border. It’s a lacy thing, kinda retro, kinda now and really nifty for wearing on balmy days and cool evenings. And surprise! It has armholes, which make it easier to wear than most shawls.

Size

XS-M, (L-XL, 2X-3X, 4X-5X)

Materials

26 (28, 29, 30) oz Lion Brand Baby Soft #920-153 Black, or any sport-weight or weight category 2 yarn

I hook or size needed to obtain gauge

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished shawl

name: Felted Entrelac Handbag pdf
description:
Capture the distinctive look of entrelac in a beautiful felted handbag. Choose two, three or more colors of 100% wool worsted-weight yarn, crochet with a large hook, then felt using your washing machine.

Size

Handbag shown is about 10” high, 7” wide and 4” deep at base. Formulas and instructions are given for making any size bag.

name: How to Crochet Adorable Amigurumi pdf
description:
Adorably simple, enchantingly cute, crocheted critters are capturing hearts around the world. Called “amigurumi” in Japan, these charming little pets are easy and fun to make. This English-language pattern book shows you how to create amigurumi animals that are true expressions of your creative side. 12 patterns include cat, monkey, bear, frog, turtle and more.

Size

3” to 12” tall

Materials

All animals are made with size G hook and worsted-weight yarn, and are stuffed with polyester fiberfill.

Safety Notice

Buttons and small parts can be a hazard to small children. To be safe, all animals intended for use as toys should have embroidered eyes.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished items.

name: Boboletta Cocoon Sweater pdf
description:
Fun to make and fun to wear, this wonderful cocoon sweater is figure-flattering and loaded with vintage style.
Overlap the shawl collar and add a bow, brooch or crocheted rose (rose pattern included), or wear it open in front like a cardigan. Seamless styling means when you're finished crocheting, your sweater is ready to wear.

Size

Instructions are included for using any yarn with any hook size to fit virtually any size from S-5X.

Materials

Garment can be made with any yarn with appropriate hook size. Blue garment shown was made with sport-weight wool from Brown Sheep Company.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished sweater

name: Pink Potholders and Dishcloths pdf
description:
Sweet pink potholders and dishcloths add a dash of fairy-tale whimsy to your kitchen. Made with 100% cotton worsted-weight yarn, these handy helpers are as practical as they are pretty—potholders are made with a doubled strand of yarn for thick protection for your hands. Decorations, details and dishcloths are made with single strand. These make wonderful housewarming and shower gifts.

Size

6-9” across

Skill level

Intermediate

Materials

When making potholders, consider yarn choices carefully for safety. The safest potholders are made from 100% cotton with stitches close enough together so there are no holes through which to burn fingers. Acrylic yarn, which can melt under high heat, is theoretically fine for potholders that will be hung on the wall or otherwise displayed, or for potholders that will be used as hot mats instead of for removing hot pans from an oven. However, as potholders get passed along for years after they are made (at least in our family), you can never be sure that a potholder you make for display will not be used at some point in the future. To be safe, I recommend 100% cotton yarn.

When designing these potholders, I decided to go for double thickness and double safety. I used a doubled strand of 100% cotton yarn for the base of each potholder. The yarn I chose is CottonTots by Bernat, which comes in a lot of cheery colors and is traditionally used for making items for babies and children. I love its softness, loft and wavy texture. Each 100g/3.5 oz ball has about 156m/176 yds.

Any of these designs can be made with any 100% cotton worsted-weight yarn, since CottonTots is actually a weight-category 4 yarn, the same size as worsted-weight. Gauge is not critical.

CottonTots colors used:

#90005 Wonder White

#90421 Strawberry

#90420 Pretty n Pink

#90230 Sweet Green

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished items

name: Lilliana Pineapple Jacket pdf
description:
Add a dramatic flourish to your outfit for any occasion with this lovely crocheted shrug-style jacket bordered with a generous pineapple edging. 

Wear Lilliana open down the front or pinned at center front. The pineapples fall gracefully around the shawl collar, bottom, and the generous bell sleeves. It’s lovely falling naturally with no pin, or with a new or vintage jeweled brooch or button holding it in place.

Size

XS-5X

Materials

Instructions are written so that you can use any soft lightweight worsted yarn, or even sport-weight yarn, with a size H or I hook. Gauge is not really important with this garment; garment is worked to certain measurements. Garment shown is made with Lion Brand Glitterspun. Best results are obtained with yarn containing some rayon, nylon, or similar material for proper drape.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished jacket

name: Gracelynn Collection Lacy Mobius Wraps pdf
description:
These beautiful mobius wraps are made with elegant lace patterns, and are perfect for every occasion from casual to formal. These designs can be made with any yarn with appropriate hook size, and can be made to fit any size. 

Skill level

Intermediate

Size

These designs can be made to fit any size.

Materials

Can be made with any yarn with appropriate hook size.  Items shown were made with Red Heart Soft.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished wraps

name: Tunisian Sampler Afghan pdf
description:
Thirty-five Tunisian crochet stitch patterns form this heirloom sampler afghan. Designed for stitching with worsted-weight yarn and size L and M Tunisian crochet hooks. Step-by-step photos and instructions for Tunisian crochet included. Color photo of each block included.

Skill level: Intermediate.

Size

47" x 65 1/2" plus fringe

Materials

Made with worsted-weight yarn and size L and M Tunisian crochet hooks.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished afghan

name: Suzette Doll pdf
description:
Sassy Suzette is a large and lovely diva—ready for shopping and a mani-pedi! She’s 16” tall from the tip of her strappy sandals to the top of her poufy hair. Wonderful whimsical plus-size shaping is made with increases and decreases and a small amount of optional needlesculpting.

Size

16 inches tall

Skill level

Intermediate

Materials

Worsted weight yarn: 200 yds. peach or skin color; small amounts grape and medium green for dress (A and B), dark brown or desired hair color, hot pink or desired purse color, yellow and green for flower and leaf

F or G hook or size needed to obtain gauge

1 yard ¼” ribbon

Enough beads of any kind to string a 7-8” length

Bead stringing thread and needle

Tapestry needle

Polyester fiberfill

3/8” black round doll eyes

Safety notice

Buttons and small parts can be a hazard to small children. This doll was not designed to be a toy; however, if you wish to make it as a toy, embroider eyes.

*NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished doll

name: Posy Toes Slippers pdf
description:
Decorate your toes with posies! Made with extra-bulky yarn or a double strand of worsted-weight, these boutique slippers can be made to fit any size. Pattern includes instructions for custom fitting as well as standard sizing for women’s size 4-11 and four width options. Choose from a variety of decorative options including roses, flowers, leaves, pompoms and fans.

Size

Instructions are written to fit women’s size 4-5 (6-7, 8-9, 10-11) in narrow, (medium, wide and extra-wide widths). Instructions are also given for custom fitting as you go.

Materials

Slippers are made with extra-bulky yarn (weight category 6) or a double strand of four-ply worsted-weight yarn (weight category 3, doubled).

One pair of slippers requires about 4 ounces main color for toe/instep area, and about 3 ounces of heel color, or about 7 ounces in all. Trims can be made with yarn scraps.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished slippers

name: Arianna Mermaid Doll pdf
description:
Sweet little mermaid and her pet starfish bring a touch of the tropics into your life. She’s made with worsted-weight yarn.

Size

22” tall

Skill level

Intermediate

Materials

Four-ply worsted-weight yarn:

2 oz. each peach or skin color, teal and dark blue

Small amounts coral, gold, white, yellow, rose, medium green, red, lavender, off-white

Five colors for hair (lights and darks of two colors): mint, turquoise, teal, plum, lavender

3/8” black round doll eyes

Safety notice

Buttons and small parts can be a hazard to small children.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished doll

name: Elf Slippers pdf
description:
Celebrate the holidays with a little elfin cheer! These whimsical slippers can be made in any size from petite women’s sizes to the largest daddy elf sizes. Made with extra-bulky yarn or a doubled strand of worsted-weight. Pattern includes two styles of slippers—curly-toed slippers and pompom toe slippers.

Size

Instructions included for making slippers to fit any size from petite women’s (teen) to large men size.

Materials

Worsted-weight yarn and size K hook


**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished slippers

name: Marilynn Sweater pdf
description:
Marilynn is the perfect addition to a simple dress or top for special gatherings or any time. Flattering high neckline and scalloped edging compliment the simple, angled shaping of this elegant garment. Marilynn is beautiful over a garment with any style of neckline. The long-sleeve version adds a touch of warmth and elegance to shoulder-baring holiday dresses and tops. Made with a soft, sparkly yarn, it will be just the thing to wear to festive get-togethers. Or of you prefer, make it with any soft worsted yarn.

Size

XS-5X

Materials

While it can be made with any yarn and any hook size, I think it is prettiest made with a light worsted-weight or substantial sport-weight yarn and about a size H hook. Gauge is not important with this pattern.

The garments shown were made with Patons Brilliant, a soft, sparkly acrylic/nylon/polyester blend.

½” -3/4” shank button, any kind (optional) or garment may be held closed with brooch.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished sweater

name: Jocelyn Capelet pdf
description:
Crochet a beautiful, romantic capelet featuring a graceful combination of pineapple lace and three-dimensional roses and leaves. Made with soft worsted-weight yarn. Size XS-5X.

Skill level: intermediate

Size

XS-5X

Materials

Garment shown is made with Caron Simply Soft.

**NOTE** this is a crochet pattern, not the finished garment
